intro: Hieracium toutonianum, commonly known as the Tuotona hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It produces small, yellow to orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Hieracium toutonianum is often found in the North Island and is considered a relatively rare species in its native range.
